|prevseason=2011â12 |nextseason=2013â14 }} The '2012â13 [[Israeli Premier
League]]' was the fourteenth season since its introduction in 1999 and the 71st
season of top-tier football in Israel. It began on 25 August 2012 and ended on
20 May 2013. Ironi Kiryat Shmona were the defending champions, having won their
first Premier League title last season.

Maccabi Tel Aviv secured the title with a 2â0 win against Ironi Ramat HaSharon
on 22 April 2012. This was their 19th Israeli league title, this win gave
Maccabi Tel Aviv a 13 point advantage over the second-place team Maccabi Haifa
with four more rounds to go.
categories: 2012–13 domestic association football leagues|Israeli Premier League
